attributes.action: End experiments on animals at the Charles River Labratories in East Lothian.
attributes.additional_details: Having Charles River Labratories in Tranent, Edinburgh portrays a negative view of the area amongst residents, tourists and reflects badly on nearby businesses. Although the practice of animal experiments is already widely protested across the UK, the local residents of East Lotian and Scotland feel the practice has no place in our area and wish parliament to consider putting an end to the reputation it brings to East Lothian.
attributes.background: Protect the reputation of East Lothian and build a positive future without the stigma of animal experiments which take place at Charles River Labratories in Tranent.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions which call for actions with regard to named individuals, organisations or businesses.

Your petition is also about something that the Scottish Government and Scottish Parliament is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: https://petitions.parliament.scot/

You may also wish to contact your local council and MSP who represent you about this issue. 

You can find the name of your local council and how to contact them here: https://www.mygov.scot/find-your-local-council

You can find the name of your local MSP and how to contact them here: https://www.parliament.scot/msps
